Key Match Events: Charlotte finished the second quarter with an 18-6 run, taking advantage of Cunningham being sidelined due to foul trouble.
Seth Curry sparked the rally with a three-point play, and Bridges capped off the run by picking off a pass and hitting a 31-foot 3-pointer at the buzzer.
Pre-Game Insights: Jaden Ivey, the starting guard, is sidelined with a fractured left fibula.
Post-Match Reflections: With this win, Detroit continues to show resilience in the absence of key players and keeps their momentum going as they push forward in the NBA season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game remained close throughout, with the Hornets holding a narrow 47-46 lead at halftime.
Despite the late surge from Charlotte, the Pistons maintained their composure in the second half to seal the victory.
